TestDescription.name: Apache JServ protocol service
TestDescription.Description: The Apache JServ Protocol (AJP) is a binary protocol that can proxy inbound requests from a web server through to an application server that sits behind the web server. It's not recommended to have AJP services publicly accessible on the internet. If AJP is misconfigured it could allow an attacker to access to internal resources.
TestDescription.Impact: No impact is associated with this alert.
TestDescription.Recommendation: It's recommended to restrict access to this service on production systems.
